alert.note: Alert for Banner; Kimball; Scotts Bluff (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued August 07 at 5:31PM CDT until August 07 at 6:15PM CDT by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: The National Weather Service in Cheyenne has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Southwestern Scotts Bluff County in the Panhandle of Nebraska... Northwestern Kimball County in the Panhandle of Nebraska... Banner County in the Panhandle of Nebraska... Southeastern Goshen County in southeastern Wyoming... Northeastern Laramie County in southeastern Wyoming... * Until 515 PM MDT. * At 430 PM MDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over La Grange, or 30 miles southwest of Scottsbluff, moving east at 50 mph. HAZARD...Golf ball size hail and 60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...People and animals outdoors will be injured. Expect hail damage to roofs, siding, windows, and vehicles. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations impacted include... La Grange, Albin, Hawk Springs Recreation Area, Harrisburg, Meriden Rest Area and Hawk Springs Campground. This replaces the Severe Thunderstorm Warning which was previously in effect for the warned area. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: Prepare immediately for large hail and damaging winds. People outside should move immediately to shelter inside a strong building. Stay away from windows.
